name: E. Misha and Paintings
statement:
Misha has a n
times n matrix, where the number in row i and column j is equal to a_{i,
j}. Misha wants to modify the matrix to contain k distinct integers. To
achieve this goal, Misha can perform the following operation zero or
more times: choose any submatrix of the matrix (you choose (x_1,y_1),
(x_2,y_2), such that x_1
leq x_2, y_1
leq y_2, x_2 - x_1 = y_2 - y_1, then submatrix is a set of cells with
coordinates (x, y), such that x_1
leq x
leq x_2, y_1
leq y
leq y_2), choose an integer k, where 1
leq k
leq n^2, replace all integers in the submatrix with k. Please find the
minimum number of operations that Misha needs to achieve his goal.
